Job Title: Chief Marketing Officer, PDx USCAN

Location: Arlington Heights, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Job Description Summary

At GE HealthCare we deliver precision health to improve patient lives in moments that matter.

Our Pharmaceutical Diagnostics business, a division of GE HealthCare, is a leading supplier of diagnostic imaging agents used in X-Ray, CT, ultrasound, SPECT and PET imaging to provide deep insight that enables clinicians to make confident diagnostic and treatment decisions for patients. Close to a quarter of a million patients every day are imaged using a Contrast Media or Molecular Imaging agent provided or produced by GE HealthCare.

We have a strong position in multiple care areas and a well-established reputation and global footprint. Our business is present across the globe in all key geographic markets, with access to many of the Key Opinion Leaders and clinicians. We also have a wide breadth of in-house expertise such as clinical, regulatory, marketing, market access, commercial and medical affairs. We have a strong global reputation, trusted by our partners, customers, and patients.

Our strategy is to drive innovation in the field of Molecular Imaging and to disrupt the field of Contrast Media, thereby continuing to develop and strengthen our portfolio of products and services, supporting our customers and delivering improved outcomes for patients. Cardiology, Oncology and Neurology are priority care areas for us where we see significant growth potential for the use of Diagnostic Imaging to enable precision health.

Responsible for setting and extending marketing strategy throughout the organization, aligning strategy execution across all geographies in the USCAN (US, Canada) and across all modalities of the Pharmaceutical Diagnostics portfolio, and driving innovation, as well as Commercial success for the region. You will set the vision and strategy for Marketing excellence standards, leading a dedicated team of Marketing professionals and leading cross-functionally. Critical to success is the ability to work effectively with multiple partners and stakeholders, manage resources, gain buy-in to the regional marketing plan, and proactively develop effective and accountable teamwork for timely execution.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities:

Perform continuous assessment of portfolio competitiveness within region, both current and future anticipated state, and plans to maintain/improve portfolio performance and achieve Sales objectives, including revenue and market share growth plans.Provide key inputs into Strategy Reviews and resource planning, including market sizing, and forecasting and investment requirements – allocate budget and resources across the region and portfolioActively solicit and share competitive intelligence; commission market research to identify market opportunities, ensuring return on investment (ROI) in dataIdentify points of intersection and creating collaboration across the portfolio, regions, and greater GE HealthCareAttract and retain world-class marketing talent, guide their development and effectiveness as brand managersEstablish and lead marketing support team providing center of excellence support (value propositions and insights, analytics, marcomms and content marketing, digital marketing)Demonstrate operational excellence - overseeing the development and execution of regional marketing plan, inclusive of programs to increase customer awareness, preference and purchase intent across full PDx, ensuring GE HealthCare presences as regional trade shows and show sites, implementing key sponsorshipsProvide organizational leadership to support an effective Advertisement and Promotional Review system, built upon cross-functional collaboration across regulatory affairs, medical affairs, legal and compliance partners to enable the timely execution of compliant assets and programsEstablish KPIs to measure effectiveness of marketing activity in the region and be dedicated to continuous improvement, making budget decisions across the region and portfolios; understand sales support needs and ensuring feedback loops inform campaign and asset developmentContinually evaluate the product portfolio versus customer needs and competitive actions to identify opportunities for rationalization (LEAN) and strengtheningPartner with training leaders to ensure commercial teams are fully equipped with knowledge, materials and tools required for successful execution of growth objectivesPartner with Market Access team to identify customer requirements and key reimbursement and pricing programsSupport advocacy and Key Opinion Leader (KOL) programs in partnership with Medical Affairs, professional societies, and patient groupsActively support Business Development initiatives to evaluate new inorganic opportunities.Actively support Commercial Excellence and Sales to execute omni-channel strategy.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field or equivalent of degree (defined as an Associate’s Degree and at least 15 years’ experience in healthcare product marketing)10+ years’ experience in product marketing, inclusive of extensive experience in full marketing mix of activities working with sales teams and supporting commercial teams with programs to drive awareness and sales.3+ years’ experience in Marketing leadership with direct reports

Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Economics or related fieldDeep marketing expertise in strategy, market analysis, product launch and product commercialization, and brandingHealthcare product/industry acumen, preferably in diagnostic imaging and pharmaceutical imaging agentsLeadership skills to lead teams and shape/lead growth vision and marketing strategyStrong influencing skills across business functions, confidence to share difficult messages and defend decisions and make judgment callsInnovation: develop new ideas through collaboration and execute on creative ideasTeam oriented ability to motivate and work well with diverse, cross-functional teams and demonstrate GE HealthCare Cultural Operating Principles: Serve our people, patients, & customers; Lead with a lean mindset; Empower entrepreneurial spirit; Deliver the future of healthcare; Win together and have fun.

GE HealthCare offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE HealthCare will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

While GE HealthCare does not currently require U.S. employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, some GE HealthCare customers have vaccination mandates that may apply to certain GE HealthCare employees.

Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes

Experience Level (if available): Director
